info.name: CodeCamp portail entreprise Qovoltis
info.description:
Welcome to the documentation of **Qovoltis** portail entreprise test API.

This API provides a set of endpoint for user/charge point management within an organization and charge point access management with the concept of whitelist (which are essentially Access Control Lists).

The more important points to get started are below !

**Authentication : users, organizations and roles**

Only registered **users** can access ths API. Json Web Token are used for controlling authentication.

For all endpoints except *user/login* a valid JWT must be given as Bearer token. *user/login* is the endpoint that returns the token and it is accessed with basic authentication, providing email as login/password.

Users belong to **organizations** : an user can't access any data from another organization thant the one he's attached with.

Users have **roles. employee** and/or **administrator**. Employees can only access to their informations and charge points they have access on, while administrators can access and manage data of the whole organization.

**HTTP Responses**

This API indents to be as standard as possible. HTTP response codes usually indicate if things went well or wrong :

*   200 : all went well
*   400 : wrong request (invalid data provided)
*   401 : JWT wrong or expired
*   403 : you have not the right to access this resource
*   404 : the famous not found
*   5xx : api error
    

Two types of JSON responses can be returned :

*   the standard JSON response with data, message and timestamp fields.
*   the list response particularly adapted for use by JS list libraries with total, an integer, and rows an array of objects.
    

**Postman collection tips**

4 environments (CodeCamp admin Qovoltis,...) are defined to facilitate API discovery. One administrator and one employee from each default organization. The current one can be easily selected with the list on top/right of postman window.

Also when you login it automatically set the token (see user/login test script) for automatic reuse by all endpoints. You're welcome !

item.description:
This folder include endpoints only available to **administrators** and aimed for general management and consultation.

Administrators have access to their organization data:

*   organization employees
*   organization charge points
*   whitelists
    

Precise whitelist management is done with endpoints of the **whitelist** folder.

item.description:
This folder includes endpoints only available to **employees.**

For now it's only the list of charge points this employee has access to.

item.name: user

response.name: update-password too short

item.description:
This folder group general endpoints that can be used by all users, whether they are employees or administrators.

These include the login endpoint, and endpoints for retrieving personal data and updating personal data and password.

update-users/<id>/in added
update-users/<id>/in updated
update-users/<id>/out removed

item.description:
Whitelists are access control list which :

*   on one side are linked to charge points
*   on the other linked to users
    

A whitelist gives its participating users access to its charge points.

However this management can be precised by :

*   a whitelist has an *expires_at* date on which it loses effect.
*   a whitelist has a boolean field *paid_by_organization* describing if the user only has access to charge points but pays the cost, or if organization itself also pays the cost.
*   Users can be attached to whitelist with an *expires_at* date which indicates they are only linked to the whitelist until a given date.
    

Please note also that :

*   charge point can be linked to several whitelists
*   users can be linked to several whitelist
*   charge point can't be linked to whitelists of other organizations
*   users can't be linked to whitelists of other organizations
